org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules

Class MelodicRR

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chemicalmozart.model.implementations.reactionrules.MelodicRR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReactionRule

    public class MelodicRR
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReactionRule
    This ReactionRule is used to create the melodic part of a bar. It takes the following parameters :
    • Note : Which is the Note we need to set
    • Pitch : Which is the pitch of the last note set.
    The notes must hve a chord setted

    • Method Detail

      • computeResult

        public java.lang.Object[] computeResult()
        The compute result must assign the pitch of the Note. Let's say that the degree of ChordImpl is named deg. There is for the moment 2 different cases :
        - _note.get_type()==STRONG : The pitch must be chosen between the following degrees :
        • deg
        • (deg+2)%8 + ((int)(deg+2)/(int)8)
        • (deg+4)%8 + ((int)(deg+4)/(int)8)
        Then, the octave must be chosen to give the closest possible note with the new degree from _pitch. - In all the other cases : -> Choose a degree randomly -> Choose an octave close to the old one
        Specified by:
        computeResult in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        an Object array containing what should be reinjected in the solution at the end of the reaction.

      • computeSelect

        public boolean computeSelect()
        Succeeds if the position of _note is equal to the melodic number and the MelodicRR is activated
        Specified by:
        computeSelect in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        true if the present reagents are compatible with the reaction.

      • getMultiplicity

        public ReactionRule.Multiplicity getMultiplicity()
        Description copied from interface: ReactionRule
        This method must return the multiplicity of the reaction. Two of them exist:

        ONE_SHOT indicates that the reaction will happen only once, the ReactionRule will then be removed from the solution.

        INFINITY_SHOT indicates that the reaction will always happen if reagents are present, until solution inertia. Contrary to OneShot, the ReactionRule will not be removed from the solution after reaction.

        Specified by:
        getMultiplicity in interface ReactionRule
        Returns:
        the multiplicity of the reaction (ONE_SHOT or INFINITY_SHOT).
